intro: Tithymalus raphanorrhizus, commonly known as the root-leaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its root system is fibrous and can be harvested for use in traditional herbal medicine. Tithymalus raphanorrhizus is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its potential medicinal properties.
